You seem to be under the impression that Nexus turrets are supposed to be strong.

They aren’t.

At that stage of the game, **you** are supposed to defend **the turrets**, not the other way around. This is a tower *defense* game, not a towers *defend* one.

They are supposed to deter enemies from engaging on you unless they are confident they won’t misplay, and to be a roadblock to minions so that they don’t instantly march down the lane to your base.

If you make the final towers the strongest in the game, the game never ends. You already have the advantage of less space to cover to defend and closer fountain to heal and buy, you don’t need the structures to be the strongest on the field.

But incase you forgot how strong nexus towers were, look: 

* Health regeneration reduced to 5 from 15.
* Attacks now utilize a laser beam instead of a projectile.
* Attack speed increased to 4 from 0.83 - i.e. 4 instances of damage per second.
* Now gain 82.5% armor penetration.
* Now applies a debuff to its attack target: This unit deals 15% reduced damage and has 10% reduced movement speed.
* With every hit, the turret will generate 6 Heat (up to 120). The turret will deal 0.0105% bonus damage for every Heat (0.063% for 6 Heat). When a turret switches targets it will lose all current Heat.

I was actually pondering upgradable turrets (or lanes)..

What if instead of just buffing turrets, each lane had upgrades (think black market brawlers, if you have been around that long) that could be bought with tokens from large minions, shutdowns, first turret, ect?

Being able to choose to give your turret a regenerating shield, or upgrade it to a beam, or maybe fun situationals like a lane spotlight or a dash-blocking shield would be interesting and add a little choice and depth - even a losing lane can feel like they are doing something useful.

Uh, no.
Turret upgrades are terrible idea.

Especially when someone will then be tasked to buy them if lanes are failing and you can sure as hell already figure out who's going to be stuck sinking their meager income into Tower Defense mechanic - the supports. Because "carry" classes won't give up their gold. So it would become the new "support's job is to provide wards for the entire team" meta Riot curbed a few years ago.

Or, it would be an entirely bad mechanic if you suddenly lose top lane so you need to "strengthen" your defenses to give you a fair chance. But then again, you're sinking your gold into something that won't last long and you're only gimping yourself even further. So either your upgrades need to provide a mountain level of defense so that it's worth it for you to make a safe haven under your T3 turrets (and make sure it doesn't fall until you say it can) in order to pay off OR it becomes that good so every champion can basically purchase TD and delay the laning phase as much as possible.

In the end, you end up with gameplay where no matter how much of a lead you secure for yourself, your enemy can say "fuck you" and decide to freeze a lane until he's fat and plump, ready to fight you. And then you'll see no comps that would want to take some risky plays, everyone would be content in just farming for 20 minutes until time's up and teamfights need to start happening.

You should at least read a post before you bash it.

All of your points are either totally irrelevant or easily resolved by not making it ludicrously overpowered - how is it any different from just buffing turrets, aside from having a bit more control and potential for synergy/counterplay?

I did read it and that's why i said your idea of investing in "upgradable" turrets is bad. If someone needs to pay for this upgrade, the gameplay doesn't revolve around strengthening your champion anymore and taking down objectives.

If the upgrade isn't strong enough, why even bother spending gold if the turret is going to fall anyway? Giving you 5+ minutes more under it while you're losing isn't going to give you back your lane and if you're ahead, you're never going to invest in such a mechanic anyway. Therefore, the only option is that these upgrades be actually super strong in order to pay off or still end up as a useless and unnecessary mechanic.

Besides, this is exactly the same mechanic we had in Nexus Siege, even if it was a little over the top.

Buffing turrets is something that benefits both teams while making a mechanic that gives turrets optional buffs while you spend gold on it, makes games bad in their entirety. Teams that are ahead will never invest in it while defending teams would exclusively spend gold making their base defenses stronger, again resulting in games where individual lane leads could be negated completely in favor of turtling base defenses.

In the off chance that the invested turret buffs by the losing team aren't enough, you've just spent the meager amount of gold you had and thrown it away. That means you can't contest anything, you can't defend your base and you can't fight the enemy. So you might as well sit AFK in base waiting for the enemy team to finish.

So I was just watching a VOD on a player in season 5 (I think is when we had laser beam turrets?) where they were playing Riven.

It got towards the end of the match where this Riven player was diving a TF under an inhibitor turret.

As this player dove under the turret the turret's beam engages on an enemy minion. The second the Riven attacks TF the turret stays locked onto the minion until it kills it. It doesn't shift aggro since it's aggro was already locked onto an existing enemy unit. 

So what I'm saying is that I think we don't have beam turrets anymore because of how inconsistent turret aggro is to shift. Something so minor as a minion can soak up the turret DPS while the other champions can go ham on their dives and effectively leaving unscathed. Whereas the current tower shots will shift aggro per shot once it notices an enemy champion is diving and will immediate queue an attack on the diver.

EDIT:

Here's the VOD. It's Faker's Riven so I could assume he has a great understand of a turrets attack range. But you can see that once the tower begins attacking an enemy melee minion it doesn't shift aggro until Faker lands a basic attack right underneath the turret. Even though before the basic attack he landed a knock up from Riven's 3rd Q right underneath the tower, which looks to be well in range of the tower to fire at him.

https://youtu.be/we2Sp-hnzuY?t=26m57s

I suggested something similar to this awhile back, but it was sadly ignored...

Right now turrets are laughably weak and a big part of why many games are decided in 10 mins. The ease of early dives right now is simply unacceptable. My though was that turrets, all turrets, should target champions like the old inhib towers.

When they target a champion, they should still do a respectable chank of damage on initial contact, but then continue to fire a beam of steadily increasing DPS while inflictin a light debuff to movement and attack speeds. This would make early game dives MUCH more risky and would stop champs like Trynd, Garen, and Duuuuurrrrrrius from just chasing people under a tower for free.

Current Turrets only need 3 things:
A % damage reduction: 35% for Outer Turrets, 40% for Inner Turrets, 45% for Inhinbitor Turrets and 50% for Nexus Turrets, plus a 5% more per allied champion in a close range, for example, 500 distance units.
A DotA2 ability, called "Backdoor Protection". This ability avoid champions damage the towers without having enemy creeps closed to the turret. No necesary to have siege or super minions in the wave.
And a bit more attack speed, because with the problem having only an 0.83 of attack speed, is that they take a long time to retarget an enemy champion who is attacking an allied champion. Whit an attack speed of 1.1, will be enought to solve the problem.
And just only these 3 things, imo nothing more.
